content.raw: Since this has been approved and merged, I'd say there is no chance it goes back to what it used to be, and a very low probability (if any) that it changes again.
content.html: Since this has been approved and merged, I'd say there is no chance it goes back to what it used to be, and a very low probability (if any) that it changes again.

content.raw: Louise, can I atleast get a confirmation that since these pull requests were not official yet, is there a possibility that all these pull request removed entirely regarding the chokes on the cable returning it back to the original choke-less? If so that would mean I'd have to develop code for all the different cables that came out for each change. Or rather that any of these three cable types could show up during the final competition?
content.html: Louise, can I atleast get a confirmation that since these pull requests were not official yet, is there a possibility that all these pull request removed entirely regarding the chokes on the cable returning it back to the original choke-less? If so that would mean I'd have to develop code for all the different cables that came out for each change. Or rather that any of these three cable types could show up during the final competition?

content.raw: Hmm at this rate it may seem that automation may not exactly be too important here. Since things seems to be changing rather quickly at the end we may just end up with a completely unknown state of the cable during competition. Kind of stressful I can agree. Or just require extremely confusing automation that does calculations for all three different cables. Eh.
content.html: Hmm at this rate it may seem that automation may not exactly be too important here. Since things seems to be changing rather quickly at the end we may just end up with a completely unknown state of the cable during competition. Kind of stressful I can agree. Or just require extremely confusing automation that does calculations for all three different cables. Eh.

update.description:
# issue #154

Added a choke to the cable, it should make it easier to pick it up

![choke3.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/3952686112-choke3.png)
![choke2.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/3958359960-choke2.png)
![choke1.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/3478191112-choke1.png)
![choke4.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/1747423285-choke4.png)

* 3 cylinders for visual and for collision
* narrowest cylinder is the one which needs to touch the panel outlet to be plugged

# issue #144

Lifted the solar array and the table 0.2 m so that they're more comfortable to reach

![array1.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/3997221921-array1.png)
![table_high.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/1128275303-table_high.png)

* Stretched meshes 0.2 m down
* Placed all objects which go on top of array and table 0.2 m higher
* This also helps with issue #153
update.title: Improve graspability

content.raw: As part of my review, I refactored the erb in 4093c17161e6. Look at the diff of unique.world in that commit without whitespace from [line 1483](#!/osrf/srcsim/commits/4093c17161e6?w=1#Lworlds/unique.worldF1486T1483) to [line 3610](#!/osrf/srcsim/commits/4093c17161e6?w=1#Lworlds/unique.worldT3610) to see that there was only one substantive change to the cable model, which was fixing the spelling of one of the collision names in the contact sensor.
content.html: As part of my review, I refactored the erb in 4093c17161e6. Look at the diff of unique.world in that commit without whitespace from line 1483 to line 3610 to see that there was only one substantive change to the cable model, which was fixing the spelling of one of the collision names in the contact sensor.

content.raw: Thank you. I overlooked the fixture sizes and geometries part.
content.html: Thank you. I overlooked the fixture sizes and geometries part.

content.raw: I think the erb logic could be simplified a bit; I will make a commit on a separate branch after looking into it further
content.html: I think the erb logic could be simplified a bit; I will make a commit on a separate branch after looking into it further

content.raw:
Hi @vinayak_jagtap, I totally understand your concerns regarding code freeze. I apologize for taking so long, we're working on sorting out all the issues as fast as we can.

That said, I'd like to point out 2 things:

1. The previous cable design hadn't been merged or released, so you've worked with it at your own risk
1. The rules state that "*parameters in the final SRC arenas will be altered from those of the practice arenas such that the exact configuration, **fixture sizes and geometries**, friction coefficients, the communications parameters, and a variety of other minor adjustments will not be known in advance.*" So I'd recommend not overfitting for a specific design until we eventually reach code freeze and all the randomized parameters are known.

Again, I'm not saying you're wrong, and we're working on getting the worlds stable for teams.
content.html:
Hi @vinayak_jagtap, I totally understand your concerns regarding code freeze. I apologize for taking so long, we're working on sorting out all the issues as fast as we can.

That said, I'd like to point out 2 things:

  1. The previous cable design hadn't been merged or released, so you've worked with it at your own risk
  2. The rules state that "parameters in the final SRC arenas will be altered from those of the practice arenas such that the exact configuration, fixture sizes and geometries, friction coefficients, the communications parameters, and a variety of other minor adjustments will not be known in advance." So I'd recommend not overfitting for a specific design until we eventually reach code freeze and all the randomized parameters are known.

Again, I'm not saying you're wrong, and we're working on getting the worlds stable for teams.

content.raw: @chapulina we appreciate your efforts in making sure the tasks are designed such that it is possible to complete it. However, we spent more than 80 person hours in grasping the cable with what was available in the original pull request. This was after changing our approach from the first design of the cable. By changing the cable end again, it will impact our detection algorithm, grasp type, as well as the motion planning approach. It would be great if you can communicate some code freeze date so we don't end up developing code that we trash at the end.
content.html: @chapulina we appreciate your efforts in making sure the tasks are designed such that it is possible to complete it. However, we spent more than 80 person hours in grasping the cable with what was available in the original pull request. This was after changing our approach from the first design of the cable. By changing the cable end again, it will impact our detection algorithm, grasp type, as well as the motion planning approach. It would be great if you can communicate some code freeze date so we don't end up developing code that we trash at the end.

content.raw:
Ok, on b88b197 I changed the cable to look like this:

![cablelalala.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/4237175129-cablelalala.png)

I was able to teleop Val and grasp the cable, check out the video:

https://youtu.be/UT5f1YS21W8

You can see that one of the fingers got a nice grip all the way around the cable. I imagine the teams will have fancier control code than my teleop, so I'd say that's graspable.

What do you think? If you think this is ok, I'll apply it to all the other worlds too.
content.html:
Ok, on b88b197 I changed the cable to look like this:

I was able to teleop Val and grasp the cable, check out the video:

https://youtu.be/UT5f1YS21W8

You can see that one of the fingers got a nice grip all the way around the cable. I imagine the teams will have fancier control code than my teleop, so I'd say that's graspable.

What do you think? If you think this is ok, I'll apply it to all the other worlds too.

# issue #154

Added a choke to the cable, it should make it easier to pick it up

![choke3.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/3952686112-choke3.png)
![choke2.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/3958359960-choke2.png)
![choke1.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/3478191112-choke1.png)
![choke4.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/1747423285-choke4.png)

* 3 cylinders for visual and for collision
* narrowest cylinder is the one which needs to touch the panel outlet to be plugged

# issue #144

Lifted the solar array and the table 0.2 m so that they're more comfortable to reach

![array1.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/3997221921-array1.png)
![table_high.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/xEbAAe/images/1128275303-table_high.png)

* Stretched meshes 0.2 m down
* Placed all objects which go on top of array and table 0.2 m higher
* This also helps with issue #153
update.title: Improve graspability

content.raw:
It looks to me like the changes here bring the table and solar array heights up to 0.848382m and 0.897m, respectively.  For reference, my (sitting) computer desk is 0.75m tall, and my kitchen counters are 0.9m tall.  I think that for a surface that humans would work on standing up, 0.8m is still a little short; I'd go for closer to 0.9-1m.  That being said, I'm not at all confident about what these work surfaces would be used for, so I'll let you make the final decision there.

In terms of the plug on the end, we talked offline about making the end a large cylinder, which will be easier to grasp.  I think that is a good idea, so I'll wait to look at this further until you do that.
content.html:
It looks to me like the changes here bring the table and solar array heights up to 0.848382m and 0.897m, respectively. For reference, my (sitting) computer desk is 0.75m tall, and my kitchen counters are 0.9m tall. I think that for a surface that humans would work on standing up, 0.8m is still a little short; I'd go for closer to 0.9-1m. That being said, I'm not at all confident about what these work surfaces would be used for, so I'll let you make the final decision there.

In terms of the plug on the end, we talked offline about making the end a large cylinder, which will be easier to grasp. I think that is a good idea, so I'll wait to look at this further until you do that.
